newsitem.title: UK: Brit Gas still undecided on TransCo review.
newsitem.headline: Brit Gas still undecided on TransCo review.

text.p: British Gas said on Wednesday that its board was still undecided on whether to accept the latest proposals from the industry regulator for a new pricing regime for its pipeline unit TransCo.
The proposals from Ofgas, released on August 21, were discussed at a board meeting earlier on Wednesday.
"Acceptance or rejection is a very important decision for the company and the board will not make a final decision until the key issues have been fully explored," British Gas said in a statement.
It has until October 7 to reach a decision.
British Gas said it was still in discussion with Ofgas, which wants TransCo to slice 20 percent off its charges to gas suppliers in the year from April 1997.
It also wants price cuts in the following years of an annual 2.5 percent.
The proposals will be referred to the Monopolies and Mergers Commission if they are unacceptable to British Gas.
